intro: Curtia tenuifolia, commonly known as the slender-leafed curtia, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Meliaceae family, which includes mahogany and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds. Curtia tenuifolia is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
